decks.notes: The main objective of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Farseek and Sakura-Tribe Elder, while controlling the game with removal spells like Lightning Bolt, and ultimately winning through the combo of Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. By tutoring for specific lands using cards like Wish and exploring additional land drops with Explore and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove, the deck aims to assemble the necessary pieces to deal lethal damage to the opponent in a single turn with the Scapeshift combo.

This deck aims to quickly cycle through cards in order to set up a powerful combo that allows for a massive board presence by casting Living End. The deck includes cards that can be cycled for free or at a low cost, as well as support cards that help manipulate the top of the library. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping up to cast Living End, bringing back a large number of creatures from the graveyard to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on controlling the board with counterspells and removal, while also utilizing cheap, efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure early on. The deck also includes cards like Murktide Regent for a larger threat and utility cards such as Dress Down and Subtlety to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of aggression and control elements, this deck aims to quickly close out games while maintaining control of the battlefield.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly deploy low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. The deck includes cards like Lightning Bolt, Soul-Scar Mage, and Monastery Swiftspear to efficiently deal damage. It also utilizes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Dragon's Rage Channeler for card advantage and prowess triggers. The inclusion of the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring adds another dimension to the deck, providing additional mana and flexibility in casting spells. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and burn spells to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures such as Monastery Swiftspear, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Soul-Scar Mage to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes spells like Lightning Bolt, Wild Slash, and Unholy Heat to control the board and finish off the opponent. Additionally, the deck uses Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration for card advantage and filtering. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional mana flexibility. Overall, the key concept revolves around fast-paced aggression and efficient use of spells to maintain pressure.

The deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to fill the graveyard with creatures, then casting Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield for a powerful combo. The main strategy centers around using cards like Street Wraith and Grief to cycle through the deck while disrupting opponents with cards like Subtlety and Force of Negation. Waker of Waves and Generous Ent provide additional value for cycling cards, while Architect of Will and Shardless Agent help manipulate the graveyard for a successful Living End. Boseiju, Who Endures can provide protection for key spells in the combo.
